com.util

Class RepeatedCharacters

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.util.RepeatedCharacters

  • public class RepeatedCharacters
extends java.lang.Object
    Class with a single static method used to verify if a string has repeated characters and locate the exact position of them.
    Author:
    Ing. Eduardo Basurto

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RepeatedCharacters()
      Default constructor of the class loaded with the the Object constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Character> setRepeatedChars(java.lang.String str)
      Method used to verify if a string has a repeated character in it.
      java.lang.String toStringPositions(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Character> repeated)
      Gets a string with the positions of the repeated characters in the following format: x:x:x:x Where the x's are the number of the position where the error was found.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RepeatedCharacters

        public RepeatedCharacters()
        Default constructor of the class loaded with the the Object constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • setRepeatedChars

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Character> setRepeatedChars(java.lang.String str)
        Method used to verify if a string has a repeated character in it. If the string has zero characters repeated, it returns an empty HashMap, otherwise, it returns a Map object with Key as the position of the repeated character in the original string, and Value as the Character itself.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to be verified
        Returns:
        The map containing the pairs of repeated characters with the position of them in the original alphabet.

      • toStringPositions

        public java.lang.String toStringPositions(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Character> repeated)
        Gets a string with the positions of the repeated characters in the following format:
        • x:x:x:x
        Where the x's are the number of the position where the error was found. If the string evaluated doesn't have errors, it returns an empty string.
        Parameters:
        repeated - The Map containing the position and the character
        Returns:
        The string with the position of the errors in the characters evaluated
